title: Is EdTech a tough industry? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, it can be and particularly for a startup. The buying cycles for school districts (in K-12) and postsecondary education are long (6–12 months). This makes sales and marketing challenging in a resource constrained environment. Also, finding an internal champion that has the weight to get the deal done is difficult. On the B2C side, consumer acquisition cost is a different but tough game; consumers often aren’t willing to pay more than $25-$50 per month for a product or service…depending on your customer retention it translates to customer LTR of $100-$750 in many circumstances…which means you have to be hyper efficient in terms of CAC. Notable that success or failure in education is often determined less by efficacy of the product than by sales and marketing prowess.

The answer is any industry seems tough to one if they are not familiar with it. But a strategic and mindful research on the industry can help one easily figure out what the industry is all about. Right now, this industry has grown up to be one of the most flourishing industries; posing great competition to other industries. So a mindful step into this industry can be really rewarding for start-ups in terms of both capital returns and value out of the trade.
